> That's not exactly what I was arguing.  I was saying that if you do 
> two phases, only-complexifying followed by only-simplifying, that's 
> going to be less efficient than using both dynamics in the first 
> place.

Are you saying that you have a delete mutation?

For me, I think that a mixed method (simulataneous add and remove) 
sounds more intuitive. Followed by a pure delete run once a satisfying 
answer has been found - in case you intend to use that answer away from 
the evolution run or if you're looking for minimal solutions.

with regards,
mattias
